content: OpenAI is considering creating its own AI chips due to the increasing shortage in GPU supply.

title: The BBC is blocking OpenAI data scraping but is open to AI-powered journalism (3 minute read)
content: The BBC is setting principles for using generative AI in journalism, emphasizing transparency and public interest. While it is exploring AI's potential, the broadcaster has blocked OpenAI web crawlers to safeguard copyrighted content.

title: Microsoft May Debut It’s First AI Chip In November (1 minute read)
content: Microsoft may unveil its own AI chip at the upcoming Ignite 2023 conference, ensuring the company's AI advancements remain uninterrupted and potentially positioning it to compete profitably with peers like Amazon and Google, who also use proprietary AI chips.

title: Math Solving Abilities in New AI Models (16 minute read)
content: Researchers have developed a new technique to boost the math-solving skills of open-source AI models by teaching them to use code.

title: A New Benchmark to Conduct Machine Learning Experiments (28 minute read)
content: This paper introduces MLAgentBench, a testing ground for AI to conduct machine learning experiments, just like human researchers.

title: LightSeq: A More Efficient System for Training Long-Context LLMs (18 minute read)
content: LightSeq is a novel method for training large language models with extended context lengths that addresses the limitations of previous systems like Megatron-LM.

title: MusicGen streaming (5 minute read)
content: Streaming music generation usually has to wait for all the music to be completed. However, this means real time or long generation applications struggle. With this code, you can now stream the chunks of music as they arrive.

title: SlowLlama (GitHub Repo)
content: Finetune Llama2-70b and CodeLlama on a MacBook Air without quantization.

title: Safety Risks in Fine-Tuning LLMs (6 minute read)
content: Researchers highlight potential safety issues when further customizing pre-trained large language models like Meta's Llama and OpenAI's GPT-3.5 Turbo.

title: StableLM 3B with data repeating (8 minute read)
content: Stability has trained another model, this time on 4T tokens to test data repeating. Also, due to public pushback, they removed Books3 from the data mix.

title: Unbundling AI (10 minute read)
content: AI’s broad potential raises questions about its real-world utility and reliability. As the technology matures, its evolution will require a shift from a generalized solution to one with defined, specific applications.

title: Open Source AI Business Models & Brand Moats (9 minute read)
content: We’ve seen how open source models can work and thrive over the last 25+ years. Even as they mature and become more “closed”, the open source model has lasting impacts. In the face of AI, not all playbooks are the same. This is a  thoughtful and in-depth review of open source models and how AI will play in this.

title: Replit AI free for everyone (1 minute read)
content: Replit has its own coding assistant that runs across its products. It is quite powerful, trained with Mosaic, and free for all user tiers.

title: Google Announces New Generative AI Search Capabilities For Doctors (3 minute read)
content: Google Cloud introduced AI-enhanced search tools to streamline access to diverse medical records for healthcare professionals. While the technology aims to reduce administrative work, its integration is undertaken with caution to fit seamlessly into existing workflows and ensure HIPAA compliance.

title: OpenAI Launches Residency Program with $210,000 Annual Salary (3 minute read)
content: OpenAI's Residency is an initiative to empower exceptional researchers and engineers from diverse fields to transition into the world of AI and machine learning. It is especially beneficial for researchers specializing in fields outside of deep learning and welcomes software engineers seeking to pivot into AI research roles. Residents will tackle real AI challenges while receiving a full salary.

title: How to erase Harry Potter from Llama 2 (25 minute read)
content: LLMs have been trained on massive amounts of data, much of which is copyright protected. Removing or unlearning such data is a challenge. This work uses a proxy model as a teacher to simulate a clean model and further fine-tunes the base model, which reduces knowledge of undesirable information while maintaining benchmark performance.

title: Boosting Vision Transformers for Flexible Image Resolutions (11 minute read)
content: Researchers present a solution, called Multi-Head Self-Attention Convolution (MSA-Conv), which allows Vision Transformers (ViTs) to handle images of different sizes without needing changes in their design or the need to resize images.

title: Setting New Standards in Blind Super-Resolution (18 minute read)
content: This study introduces a novel Transformer model that is tailored to blind super-resolution, a task that deals with images with unknown noise. The method outshines current approaches through its blend of traditional CNNs and a new Transformer design attuned to degradation patterns.

title: Simplex random feature attention (GitHub Repo)
content: Attention is useful but computationally expensive. However, once trained, with a bit of fine-tuning compute you can drop in SRF attention and remove the dependence on sequence length, speeding things up considerably.

title: LeptonAI (GitHub Repo)
content: A Pythonic framework to simplify AI service building.

title: Making CNNs Shine in Federated Learning (GitHub Repo)
content: This study delves into how different architectural elements in machine learning models affect their performance in federated learning, especially when handling varied data sources. Through in-depth analysis, researchers found that with certain tweaks, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) can perform as well or even better than Vision Transformers in such settings.

title: How to lose at Generative AI (4 minute read)
content: Great read on the tricky parts of creating value around generative AI for startups. While the incumbents are favored, finding your path and creating real value early is where startups can have a fighting chance.

title: AI Isn’t A Drill, And Your Users Don’t Want Holes (2 minute read)
content: AI is often misunderstood as a one-size-fits-all solution, but businesses need to recognize that it's merely a tool, and not every business requires it. Identifying genuine problems and needs should precede technology adoption, rather than trying to retrofit AI solutions where they may not be needed or beneficial.

title: How AMD might get across the CUDA moat (7 minute read)
content: There is a heavy shortage of GPUs for the current AI demand. Many services have long queue times or are restricting access as a result. If other chip makers can overcome some of their software deficiencies, maybe via recent Pytorch improvements, they may be able to compete for some of this demand.

title: Adobe Beefs Up Photoshop With AI Tools (1 minute read)
content: Adobe has released the official web version of Photoshop, equipped with AI tools powered by Firefly.

title: Microsoft Announces New AI Tools To Assist Doctors (2 minute read)
content: Microsoft introduced new AI tools in Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI to help healthcare organizations consolidate and interpret vast medical data.

title: US Warns EU’s Landmark AI Policy Will Only Benefit Big Tech (6 minute read)
content: The US warns the EU that its proposed AI regulations could favor well-resourced companies and hurt smaller ones. Washington's analysis criticizes the EU's focus on AI model development rather than the risk of model use, suggesting it could deter investment and AI R&D in the EU. The debate continues, aiming for alignment and shared AI objectives.

title: Human to robot motion retargeting (18 minute read)
content: Researchers have been able to transfer human motion onto robots by using a deep learning encoder. This is usually done with specialized hardware that has to be calibrated to the robot. Combining this with video-based motion capture could be a cool future project!

title: Leverage LLMs for Enhanced Video Understanding (18 minute read)
content: Researchers have introduced FAVOR, a new approach that allows large language models to understand videos by finely blending audio and visual details at the frame level.

title: Boosting Mathematical Reasoning of LLMs (17 minute read)
content: Researchers investigate the impact of data augmentation techniques on improving the math reasoning capabilities of large language models. They create a new dataset, AugGSM8K, by enhancing queries from an existing dataset and developing a model named MuggleMath.

title: Improving Visual Generation with a New Video Tokenization (2 minute read)
content: This study introduces MAGVIT-v2, a video tokenizer that efficiently translates image and video inputs into tokens for Large Language Models. With MAGVIT-v2, LLMs surpass the performance of diffusion models in visual generation tasks.

title: Speeding Up Diffusion Models for Text Generation (7 minute read)
content: Researchers introduce a new technique for diffusion models used in text generation. By using a soft absorbing state, they improved how the model handled discrete text changes, resulting in faster learning and quicker sampling.

title: Testing LLMs in the Competitive World of Auctions (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers have created AucArena, a simulation platform designed to test Large Language Models in auction settings, which are dynamic and require strategic thinking. Initial tests show that, with the right prompts, these models can perform impressively in auctions, showing skills like budgeting and long-term planning.

title: AI Hype Is Built On Flawed Test Scores (8 minute read)
content: A growing number of researchers want to overhaul the way LLMs are assessed, calling for more rigorous and exhaustive evaluation, as they believe the practice of scoring machines on human tests is misguided.

title: 8 ways SaaS companies can use AI to get ahead (12 minute read)
content: From task automation to writing code, AI is adding leverage to how we analyze customer data and build products. The key takeaway here is that AI is enabling people to do a lot more, and if you’re not using it, you’re likely going to get outpaced by your competition.

title: AI bias tests gloss over a crucial aspect of skin color (5 minute read)
content: Sony's AI research suggests a more "multidimensional" approach to measuring skin color, emphasizing not just lightness/darkness but also red and yellow hues. Current scales might overlook biases against certain ethnic groups. Sony recommends the CIELAB color standard, even as others tout the simplicity of systems like the Monk Skin Tone Scale. Google and Amazon are reviewing Sony's findings.

title: Deep dive into multimodal frontier models (28 minute read)
content: An excellent dive into the current research activity around multimodal language models.

title: CleanLab raises $30M to help build trustworthy LLMs (8 minute read)
content: Starting as an open sourced package at MIT, CleanLab has now grown into an enterprise-grade no-code tool for curating high quality data for industry ML pipelines.

title: Big Tech Struggles to Turn AI Hype Into Profits (8 minute read)
content: Tech giants are investing in costly generative AI tools, leading to pricier software upgrades. Firms are exploring ways to balance innovation with profitability while anticipating future cost reductions.

title: Paper for Mistral 7B model (10 minute read)
content: The Mistral 7B model was released via a tweet. It beats many models twice its size. This paper explores some of the technical contributions and details. No discussion of the pre-training dataset, but good insights into the architecture.

title: Improving Memory in Continual Text Classification (16 minute read)
content: This study explores the challenges faced in "continual learning", where a model tries to keep learning new things without forgetting old ones, especially in categorizing texts. It introduces a new method called InfoCL, which uses special techniques to help the model remember better and reduce mistakes.

title: Making AI-Generated Sentences Sound Natural (11 minute read)
content: Researchers found that the sequence in which ideas or 'concepts' are presented to models that generate sentences affects how good the sentences turn out to be. Among various programs tested, BART-large did the best job when given ideas in a certain order, but surprisingly, bigger isn't always better.

title: Open LLMetry (GitHub Repo)
content: OpenLLMetry is a set of extensions built on top of OpenTelemetry that gives you complete observability over your LLM application.

title: ChatGPT History Export To MD (GitHub Repo)
content: A Python script that converts your entire ChatGPT history and data export into neatly formatted Markdown files.

title: Enhancing Speech Recognition with a New Cross-Modal Fusion Technique (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers have developed a new technique that combines sound information and language data to correct mistakes in automatic speech recognition systems.

title: A Case For GPT-4’s Capacity To Reason (6 minute read)
content: Although GPT-4 lacks consciousness and long-term memory, there is good evidence that it is able to reason and comprehend concepts.

title: Prosecutors don’t want Bankman-Fried’s lawyers mentioning his $500 million investment in AI startup Anthropic (3 minute read)
content: Prosecutors want to prevent former FTX cofounder Sam Bankman-Fried’s attorneys from mentioning his $500M investment in AI startup Anthropic during trial, deeming it irrelevant. Meanwhile, Anthropic, seen as a competitor to OpenAI, is seeking funding that could propel its valuation to $20B-$30B, after recently securing a $1.25B commitment from Amazon.

title: Universal, interactive, real world simulator (6 minute read)
content: What if your simulator was generative AI? It would work to zero shot transfer robotic policies! This work from DeepMind and colleagues tackles the challenge that RL usually can't generalize past the training environment. If we just make everything the training environment then there is no need for extrapolating.

title: State of AI 2023 (20 minute read)
content: A great summary of the language modeling industry. There are good discussions here on safety, capabilities, chips, and more. The predictions around AI filmmaking, capital costs, and AI-fueled IPOs are interesting.

title: OpenAI Unveils Major Updates To Boost AI Development Efficiency (2 minute read)
content: OpenAI plans to introduce updates like memory storage and advanced vision capabilities in its developer tools to significantly reduce application costs and foster innovation across diverse sectors.

title: Google’s AI-Powered Search Experience Can Now Generate Images (2 minute read)
content: Google’s Search Generative Experience now lets you create images right from a text prompt.

title: Speed up cold boot times for Llama 2 (6 minute read)
content: Loading a model from cloud storage to a node GPU often takes most of the time for inference. With a few clever tricks like memory streaming, Anyscale has reduced it 20x to just arrived 30s for Llama 2 70B.

title: Text Embeddings reveal almost as much as text (12 minute read)
content: Using iterative re-embedding and treating embedding inversion as a conditional generation problem allows attackers to successfully recreate 92% of the embedded texts just with access to the dense vectors.

title: Enhanced Segmentation with SAM-OCTA (16 minute read)
content: Researchers have improved the segmentation of specific targets in optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA) images with a method called SAM-OCTA.

title: ScaleCrafter: High-Resolution Image Generation (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers studied how to produce high-quality images at large sizes using pre-trained diffusion models trained on smaller images. They discovered issues with repeated patterns in the bigger images and pinpointed the problem to the limited perception of the model's structures.

title: Improving Text to Image Generation with LLMs (4 minute read)
content: Researchers are improving how we communicate with text-to-image models, like Midjourney and Stable Diffusion, which currently require complex prompts for generating images. They've introduced "interactive text to image", allowing people to naturally interact with Large Language Models for better image creation and related tasks.

title: The big AI and robotics concept that has attracted both Walmart and Softbank (8 minute read)
content: Symbotic and Softbank have created a joint venture called GreenBox Systems that promises to deliver AI-powered logistics and warehousing to small companies. It will provide its services in facilities that different companies will share. GreenBox aims to help companies that can't afford the multi-million dollar investments required to build and operate such facilities in the same way cloud companies make high-end compute tech accessible.

title: Hugging Face Mistral model (2 minute read)
content: Trained with direct preference optimization by the Hugging Face team, this model improves chat performance on a variety of benchmarks.

title: OpenAI Is Too Cheap To Beat (3 minute read)
content: Open source models are great, but OpenAI’s ability to serve models at extreme economies of scale is a likely insurmountable advantage.

title: Eleven Labs Dubbing (Product Launch)
content: Eleven Labs released a voice translation and dubbing product that allows people to localize their content across 29 languages in seconds while supporting multiple speakers and preserving speakers’ styles.

title: How Generative AI Is Creeping Into EV Battery Development (2 minute read)
content: Aionics, a new startup, uses AI tools to accelerate the discovery of optimal electrolyte materials for batteries, aiming to produce faster-charging and more energy-dense batteries.

title: Moonhub AI Unveils the World’s First AI-powered Recruiter (5 minute read)
content: Moonhub launched its AI-powered recruiter publicly today, alongside an iconic list of 100s of partner customers like Inflection, Anthropic, You.com, Verkada, and more. Its AI helps companies start a search in minutes, hire exceptional talent 3-5x faster, and save 100s of hours per hire.

title: Flash Decoding for 8x inference speed up (12 minute read)
content: Flash Attention dramatically speeds up the training of large language models. However, when running inference, the batch size is usually 1. This means Flash Attention provides little benefit. Flash Decoding was developed by the same group and brings optimizations to token generation.

title: Using Transformers for Multiple Language Tasks (13 minute read)
content: Researchers explore the potential of pre-trained transformer decoders to create universal embeddings for both natural and programming languages. With minimal training on English data, these models excel in various tasks, from classification to code search.

title: A New Approach for Audio-Visual Segmentation (16 minute read)
content: This paper introduces the Explicit Conditional Multimodal Variational Auto-Encoder (ECMVAE) for better identification of sound sources in videos.

title: SudoLang (GitHub Repo)
content: SudoLang is a programming language designed to collaborate with AI language models including ChatGPT, Bing Chat, Anthropic Claude, and Google Bard.

title: Improving Traffic Predictions with Graph Mixformer (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers have developed the Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer (STGM) network, a new model for predicting traffic patterns.

title: Building a More Powerful 3D Model (22 minute read)
content: Researchers have introduced a new way to train 3D models, making them more efficient and versatile. Using a unique approach that blends 3D and 2D information, it shows significant improvements in tasks ranging from creating realistic images to recognizing 3D objects.

title: The AI Research Job Market Crap Show (7 minute read)
content: There are plenty of AI research jobs, but finding the job you want is as difficult as ever.

title: LLMs For Dummies (12 minute read)
content: LLMs are all the rage these days, but do you really know how they work? This article provides a high-level overview of the plumbing behind LLMs and then looks at four frameworks for LLM applications that might emerge in the startup ecosystem.

title: OpenAI’s Financial Ascent (1 minute read)
content: OpenAI’s annual revenue rate now stands at $1.3B, a far cry from 2022’s $28M.

title: Improved ROCm support (2 minute read)
content: AMD has improved support for its RDNA GPUs (including the RX 7900) and Pytorch for more training options for AI projects.

title: Startup Aims to Build Hundreds of Chip Factories with Prefab Parts and AI (6 minute read)
content: Nanotronics is a New York-based industrial AI company that wants to build an AI-enabled chip factory that can be assembled and expanded modularly with prefab pieces. Its Cubefabs system uses AI to take away the need for the specialization normally needed in a lab and allow people who are not semiconductor experts to work at the facilities. Each facility will need only about 30 people to operate. The bulk of each facility can be flat-packed and put in a shipping container.

title: TabLiB 800B tabular token dataset (2 minute read)
content: Dataset of tabular tokens to encourage the community to build Large Data Models that better understand tabular data. It is the largest publicly available tabular dataset - a compilation of 627 million tables together with 867 billion tokens of contextual information. TabLiB is available on Hugging Face.

title: Advanced Head Pose Estimation (16 minute read)
content: Figuring out the direction someone's head is turned is important for lots of tech applications. These researchers have developed a new way to estimate head positions from any angle.

title: Boosting LiDAR-Camera Detection (14 minute read)
content: The authors of this paper have created a new technique called SupFusion to make LiDAR and camera systems work together better for detecting things like cars or pedestrians.

title: Multimodal Learning without Paired Data (GitHub Repo)
content: The research introduces Ex-MCR, a novel method that efficiently learns unified contrastive representations for multiple modalities without needing paired data. By aligning existing Multi-modal Contrastive Representations, Ex-MCR achieves top performance in tasks like audio-visual retrieval and 3D object classification.

title: MosaicFusion: A Tool to Make New Images without Training (GitHub Repo)
content: MosaicFusion is like a magic tool that can create new pictures with lots of objects without needing any prior learning. It does this in two steps: first, it makes the picture, and then it creates a mask to show where each object is.

title: Enhanced Earth Observation (GitHub Repo)
content: This study introduces a new method that combines digital surface model (DSM) data and aerial images from different times to improve change detection beyond just 2D perspectives.

title: Libgen to txt (GitHub Repo)
content: Libgen is likely a dataset in many closed models. While the legality of this dataset for commercial use is under debate, researchers are still using it to better understand data quality for language model training.

title: Artificial General Intelligence Is Already Here (11 minute read)
content: Although today’s AI models aren’t perfect, there is still a strong chance that they will be eventually recognized as the first true examples of artificial general intelligence.

title: New conference for language modeling (3 minute read)
content: With the dramatic increase in interest in language modeling. Many existing ML conferences have been inundated with papers. This new venue, organized by many prominent scientists, will be a great option for publications.

title: Meta’s Unique Approach To Developing AI Puzzles Wall Street (5 minute read)
content: Although Wall Street investors have a hard time valuing and understanding Meta’s open-source approach to AI, many in the tech industry believe that positioning Llama similarly to Linux as a smart play.

title: Personal AI proof assistant (5 minute read)
content: Proof assistant tools like Lean are amazing ways to formalize and prove mathematical concepts on the computer. Morph Labs, in collaboration with many groups, is building open proof assistants. Its first model is extremely performant - based on Mistral - and is poised to help unlock more mathematical knowledge.

title: PyTorch on the edge (12 minute read)
content: The PyTorch team introduced a new lightweight runtime and conversion for models to run on resource-constrained edge devices.

title: Baidu Says ERNIE 4.0 Is As Good As GPT-4 (4 minute read)
content: Baidu has introduced ERNIE 4.0, its advanced artificial intelligence chatbot, claiming it to be on par with OpenAI’s GPT-4.

title: Deep dive: intro to real time machine learning (26 minute read)
content: Deep dive into all the components needed to build a modern real time machine learning system.

title: Visual language action models for self driving (11 minute read)
content: Wayve has introduced Lingo, a model that operates on visual data, can explain its choices, and take actions. The combined representation across modalities is a rising trend popularized by CLIP and it's a ripe area of research in robotics.

title: Improving Scene Graph Generation with LLMs (GitHub Repo)
content: Weakly-Supervised Scene Graph Generation (WSSGG) using image captions often faces challenges in capturing detailed relationships and utilizing all available information. This study introduces LLM4SGG, which leverages the capabilities of large language models to better extract and align relationships from captions.

title: Simulating Beethoven using LLMs (GitHub Repo)
content: This project introduces Character-LLM, which trained large language models to emulate historical personalities like Beethoven and Julius Caesar by feeding them tailored profiles.

title: Lightweight fast inference engine for HuggingFace diffusers (GitHub Repo)
content: Lots of small improvements have added up to substantial speed improvements (claimed 60 steps per second up from 23).

title: Insights From Finetuning LoRA (10 minute read)
content: Takeaways from hundreds of experiments fine-tuning LoRA.

title: AI FAQs (14 minute read)
content: This article debunks myths about Generative AI, highlighting the challenges in detecting AI-generated content and the need for educators to adapt. Despite uncertainties about AI's future growth, current advancements indicate that we're only at the beginning of its potential.

title: Does it Matter to You if AI Makes a Work of Art You Love? (11 minute read)
content: WSJ readers debated AI's role in art creation. Responses varied from skepticism about AI's emotional depth to seeing it as just another tool. Transparency on AI's involvement was a common theme.

title: Adept releases multimodal LLM (8 minute read)
content: Adept has released an extremely simple (no image encoder) and very performant (outperforms 13B models) multimodal model. This article outlines how Adept evaluated the model’s performance and some details about the model.

title: Mujoco 3 (6 minute read)
content: The newest version of Mujoco, a popular physics-based simulator, has been released. It's much faster and far more stable.

title: OpenAI Fails To Develop More Efficient AI Model (1 minute read)
content: OpenAI began working on Arrakis, an AI model designed to run applications more efficiently, soon after the launch of ChatGPT. However, in a rare setback, the project has failed.

title: Zipformer: A New Transformer for Speech Recognition (17 minute read)
content: The study introduces Zipformer, a revamped transformer for automatic speech recognition (ASR) that's faster, uses less memory, and outperforms the widely-used Conformer.

title: Use small models to study large models (25 minute read)
content: Instabilities in training at large scales are hard to reproduce for most researchers. This paper shows how to reproduce instabilities in small models and verifies that many commonly reported fixes work just as well on these small models.

title: A More Efficient Language Model Architecture (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers have developed BitNet, a new design for large language models that uses much less energy and memory.

title: ChatGPT System Prompts (GitHub Repo)
content: System prompts allow you to change the behavior of ChatGPT-based language models. This repository contains some very well constructed system prompts that could improve usability based on your preferences.

title: Local chatbot with memory (GitHub Repo)
content: MemGPT is a local chatbot that can read and write to memory. This allows you to have a local assistant that remembers important context about previous conversations.

title: A New Approach to 3D Object Detection from Single Images (GitHub Repo)
content: This repository introduces MonoSKD, a groundbreaking method for detecting 3D objects using only one image that effectively bridges the knowledge gap between LiDAR and regular RGB-based models.

title: Commercializing AI in Healthcare: The Enterprise Buyer Perspective (10 minute read)
content: No doubt AI will have a hand in healthcare - it's just a question of how and by how much. This step-by-step guide is ridiculously helpful if you’re starting an AI-for-healthcare company.

title: The World’s Biggest AI Models Aren’t Very Transparent (3 minute read)
content: Stanford HAI's new Foundation Model Transparency Index reveals that major AI foundation model developers do not provide enough information on their societal impacts. While Meta's Llama 2 scored the highest in transparency at 54%, followed by BloomZ and OpenAI's GPT-4, none achieved particularly high scores, with concerns raised about areas like data sources, societal impact, and potential biases.

title: Foxconn And Nvidia Are Building AI Factories (2 minute read)
content: Nvidia and Foxconn are collaborating to create "AI factories" designed to supercharge the development of autonomous vehicles and industrial robots.

title: DALLE-3 research paper (24 minute read)
content: This paper outlines the main ingredients to DALLE-3's amazing performance. They include a synthetic caption generator, improved modeling with latent diffusion, and improved metrics for faithfulness, style, and coherence.

title: $13M seed for multimodal search (2 minute read)
content: Objective raised a seed round to build a low-code multimodal search toolkit for enterprise.

title: Fuyu-8B: A Multimodal Architecture for AI Agents (12 minute read)
content: Fuyu-8B, a multimodal model designed for digital agents, is now available on HuggingFace. Unlike other multimodal models, it has a simplified architecture and supports arbitrary image resolutions, responding to large images in under 100ms. Though tailored for specific applications, Fuyu-8B still excels at standard image understanding benchmarks.

title: Benchmarking LLM’s Grasp of Factuality (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers introduce FACTCHD, a benchmark designed to detect when large language models, like ChatGPT, produce factually incorrect information, especially in complex scenarios.

title: The World of NLP: A Comprehensive Taxonomy (22 minute read)
content: This study introduces a detailed classification system to understand research on generalization in natural language processing.

title: Tackling Real-world Face Anti-Spoofing Challenges (4 minute read)
content: Researchers present DGUA-FAS, a method designed to address anti-spoofing challenges, especially when faced with changes in domain and unfamiliar attack types. It uses a Transformer-based feature extractor and a special network to simulate unknown attacks. This approach proves more effective in handling both known and unknown threats.

title: XAgent (GitHub Repo)
content: XAgent is an open-source experimental LLM-driven autonomous agent that can automatically solve various tasks.

title: Mojo🔥 available on Apple Silicon (3 minute read)
content: The exciting systems language for AI is now available on Mac. It outperforms many powerful languages like C++ while being easier to write like Python.

title: Waymo simulator (4 minute read)
content: Waymo has introduced its Waymax simulator for evaluating the performance of agents on self-driving tasks. It is written entirely in Jax.

title: The Geometry Of Truth (8 minute read)
content: Interactive charts for exploring how LLMs represent truth.

title: Halloween LoRA photo booth (Hugging Face Space)
content: Fun edits with Stable Diffusion to change your picture into a spooky Halloween-themed character.

title: Benefits Of Small LLMs (2 minute read)
content: Smaller LLMs might surpass larger ones due to advantages like quicker training, ability to run locally without specialized hardware, cost-effectiveness, lower latency, ease of deployment, and potential for better interpretability and reproducibility.

title: Universal Music sues Anthropic over AI-generated lyrics (6 minute read)
content: Universal Music is suing AI start-up Anthropic for copyright infringement, alleging the chatbot "Claude" reproduces copyrighted lyrics without permission. The music industry is contending with AI's capability to create "deepfake" songs.

title: New Nvidia AI Agent Can Train Robots (4 minute read)
content: Nvidia Research has developed Eureka, an AI agent powered by OpenAI's GPT-4 that autonomously trains robots in complex tasks.

title: OpenAI in Talks for Deal That Would Value Company at $80 Billion (4 minute read)
content: OpenAI is reportedly nearing a deal led by Thrive Capital that would push its valuation to $80 billion, tripling its value in under six months. This surge in its valuation started with OpenAI's ChatGPT launch, igniting significant investments in leading AI companies. AI entities remain investor favorites despite waning start-up funding due to their transformative potential in tech.

title: ‘Mind-Blowing’ IBM Chip Speeds Up AI (3 minute read)
content: IBM has developed a brain-inspired computer chip (NorthPole) that significantly enhances AI's speed and efficiency by reducing the need to access external memory.

title: Deep dive: building LLM-powered web apps (8 minute read)
content: Most organizations don't have the resources to serve large models on GPUs, but there's a strong open-source push to run these models locally. This post explores that push and LangChain + Ollama integrations.

title: Making AI Forget Safely with a New Method (GitHub Repo)
content: This project introduces a new method called 'saliency unlearning' (Salun) that improves how AI systems forget data.

title: SolidGPT (GitHub Repo)
content: Chat with and learn from your code repository.

title: State of Mark prompting (GitHub Repo)
content: With language models becoming multimodal, we now have more ways than ever to prompt them. State of Mark prompting runs images through Segment Anything first and numbers the detected classes. It then uses that to prompt visual models.

title: Caption Up sampling (GitHub Repo)
content: One of the main drivers of quality for the new DALLE-3 image generation model is improved data quality. This was obtained via caption upsampling with internal models. Here is an implementation with strong open-source models.

title: Open-source model for extracting structured data (HuggingFace Hub)
content: One of the main enterprise use cases for AI models is extracting structured data like JSON or CSV from unstructured text. This is mostly done today with function calls to gpt-3.5-turbo. GoLLIE performs slightly better in general and can be run more confidently with sensitive data.

title: Math Is Hard (5 minute read)
content: Despite claims to the contrary, MathGLM still can not do math. This highlights the limitations of relying solely on large language models for certain tasks.

title: Nvidia Brings Generative AI Compatibility To Robotics Platforms (2 minute read)
content: Nvidia's Deepu Talla highlights the advancements in generative AI for robotics, with the company unveiling tools in the Jetson Generative AI Lab to boost productivity, enable natural language interfaces, and enhance AI deployments at the edge.

title: Apple Rumored to Follow ChatGPT With Generative AI Features on iPhone as Soon as iOS 18 (2 minute read)
content: Apple plans to start implementing generative AI technology in iOS in late 2024 at the earliest. The company will likely build hundreds of AI servers over the next two years. It will probably offer a combination of cloud-based and on-device AI. The time frame seems to line up with the release of iOS 18.

title: Introducing The Foundation Model Transparency Index (7 minute read)
content: A team of researchers from Stanford, MIT, and Princeton has developed a transparency index to evaluate the level of transparency in commercial foundation models. The index, known as the Foundation Model Transparency Index (FMTI), assesses 100 different aspects of transparency, and the results indicate that there is significant room for improvement among major foundation model companies.

title: Shared fate: Protecting customers with generative AI indemnification (3 minute read)
content: Google is offering its customers two indemnities to mitigate the risks associated with generative AI. The first covers training data, protecting users against third-party intellectual property infringements. The second, generated output indemnity, covers IP claims made against content created using Google products, assuming responsible AI practices are followed.

title: Evaluating Chatting Abilities of LLMs in Multi-Turn Dialogues (12 minute read)
content: This study assesses the ability of large language models (LLMs) to engage in human-like multi-turn conversations.

title: SALMONN: The AI Model Tuned to Understand the World of Sound (18 minute read)
content: This paper introduces SALMONN, a unique AI model that combines text understanding with the ability to process various audio inputs, from speech to music. Not only does SALMONN perform well in trained audio tasks like speech recognition, it also shows impressive emergent skills like translating speech into untrained languages.

title: A New Approach to Lidar Panoptic Segmentation (GitHub Repo)
content: This project presents a novel detection-centric network for lidar panoptic segmentation (LPS) and tracking, moving away from the traditional segmentation-focused methods.

title: Improving Object Localization with a New Method (GitHub Repo)
content: Weakly supervised object localization helps find objects using only simple picture labels. The new Background Activation Suppression (BAS) method does this better by focusing on important parts of a picture and ignoring the rest, showing amazing results on several datasets.

title: Make a fine-tune.jsonl programmatically (6 minute read)
content: Tuning language models requires creating training data in a specific format. This is often frustrating and slow. This post dives into easy ways to automate that process.

title: Holly Elmore And Rob Miles Dialogue On AI Safety Advocacy (32 minute read)
content: AI Pause organizer Holly Elmore and AI Safety YouTuber Rob Miles have a long discussion on AI safety.

title: Every app that adds AI looks like this (5 minute read)
content: The AI boom has led to an oversaturation of startups with some raising massive funds on just a pitch deck, potentially indicating overhype and overvaluation. Experts caution that not all startups are innovators; many simply imitate. There should be more authenticity and clarity in AI branding and utility and less marketing of subpar AI tools as "magic".

title: Can GPT-4 teach a robot hand to do pen spinning tricks better than you do? (7 minute read)
content: Eureka is an open-ended agent that designs reward functions for robot dexterity at a super-human level - it can learn pen-spinning tricks, something that is difficult for CGI artists to animate frame by frame.

title: OpenAI plans major updates to lure developers with lower costs (5 minute read)
content: OpenAI is planning significant updates to help developers create AI-based applications more affordably and swiftly. The updates include the addition of memory storage and new vision capabilities for developers that could greatly reduce development costs. The enhancements are expected to be announced at OpenAI’s first-ever developer conference on November 6th.

title: Leading AI Expert Advocates for Urgent Global Response to AI Risks Comparable to Climate Crisis (4 minute read)
content: Google's AI unit's CEO, Demis Hassabis, warns that the world needs to address AI risks urgently, similarly to the climate crisis. He suggests an oversight body like the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change to tackle dangers from AI. Hassabis believes AI could be highly beneficial, but its potential risks require international attention.

title: This new data poisoning tool lets artists fight back against generative AI (5 minute read)
content: Researchers from the University of Chicago have developed a tool that allows artists to add invisible changes to their artwork. Nightshade causes AI models trained on these pieces to malfunction. The tool aims to deter AI firms from using artists' works without permission. Nightshade will be integrated into Glaze, a tool for artists to mask their styling, and will be made open-source for wider use.

title: Improved video diffusion with noise scheduling (25 minute read)
content: Generating a single image from a single prompt is generally fine, but fails when generating video because of the temporal changes between frames. However, consistency when changing text is quite challenging. This work tackles both of these problems and enables generations up to 512 frames long using diffusion.

title: Using Segment Anything Model for 3D Medical Imaging (GitHub Repo)
content: SAM-Med3D is an upgraded version of the Segment Anything Model (SAM) tailored specifically for 3D medical imaging. While the original SAM struggled with 3D medical images, SAM-Med3D, trained on a vast dataset of over 131K 3D masks, delivers superior results by capturing 3D spatial details with fewer input prompts.

title: Meta’s Habitat 3.0 Simulates Real-World Environments For Intelligent AI Robot Training (2 minute read)
content: Meta’s FAIR team has launched Habitat 3.0, an enhanced AI simulation environment for training robots to navigate real-world scenarios.

title: DeepSparse (GitHub Repo)
content: DeepSparse is a CPU inference runtime that takes advantage of sparsity to accelerate neural network inference.

title: Enhanced Visual Reasoning with Vision-Language Models (GitHub Repo)
content: The repo introduces Cola, a system that uses a large language model to coordinate various vision-language models (VLMs) for improved visual reasoning.

title: AgentTuning (GitHub Repo)
content: Instruction-tune LLMs using interaction trajectories across multiple agent tasks.

title: Emotional labor is how we differentiate from AI (1 minute read)
content: Showing up with a smile and a handshake is something AI can’t do, for now.

title: Leaked Google AI Innovations: Multimodal Gemini and Revolutionary App Prototyping Feature, Stubbs (6 minute read)
content: Google is replacing PaLM 2 with Gemini, a multimodal AI model coming to Makersuite, which will offer image and text recognition features. The company also has a hidden tool called Stubbs that enables users to build and launch AI-generated app prototypes. Makersuite will soon fully support language translation.

title: Can OpenAI Win Consumer And Enterprise? (2 minute read)
content: OpenAI has so far won both consumer and enterprise with ChatGPT and APIs respectively, but whether they will be able to continue to do so remains unknown.

title: AI Startup Perplexity Valued at $500 Million After New Funding Led by IVP (3 minute read)
content: AI search startup Perplexity has secured a new round of funding led by IVP that reportedly values the one-year-old company at $500m. Perplexity uses artificial intelligence to challenge Google’s dominance in online search with an AI-powered search engine and a new iOS app. It reported a $3m annual recurring revenue as of this month.

title: Drafting AI Constitution through a Democratic Process (14 minute read)
content: Anthropic, in partnership with the Collective Intelligence Project, developed a new AI system using a constitution sourced from the public to explore democratic influences on AI. It gathered input from ~1,000 Americans via the Polis platform where participants could vote on or suggest principles for the AI chatbot. The resulting "Public" model, which showed a greater emphasis on accessibility and impartiality, performed comparably to Anthropic's standard model in understanding tasks and bias evaluations.

title: Google AI Offers Expanded Indemnity Protections (3 minute read)
content: Google now offers two indemnities for generative AI products: one covering the use of training data, protecting customers from third-party intellectual property infringement claims, and a second indemnifying clients for generated outputs from a range of Google Cloud services given responsible AI practices. These measures aim to reassure customers using Google's generative AI services against potential copyright infringement claims.

title: Answering questions over long, structured documents (25 minute read)
content: Retrieving information from structured text documents is a well-studied problem that gets much harder when the documents are PDFs. Adobe Research has introduced a tool that allows you to condition either structure or text for retrieval. It also released a benchmark dataset for further study.

title: Boosting Recommender Systems with LLMs (GitHub Repo)
content: This project introduced RLMRec, a framework that combines LLMs with recommender systems, capturing the deeper meanings of user behaviors and preferences and enhancing the quality of recommendations.

title: VidChapters-7M: A New Tool for Easier Video Navigation (4 minute read)
content: VidChapters-7M is a big collection of videos with 7 million user-made chapter marks. This new dataset helps in the creation and testing of methods for splitting videos into chapters and naming them, making it simpler for viewers to find what they're looking for.

title: SpellTest (GitHub Repo)
content: AI-to-AI testing for LLM-based applications.

title: ReactAgent (GitHub Repo)
content: ReactAgent is an experimental autonomous agent that uses GPT-4 to generate and compose React components from user stories.

title: Polyfire (GitHub Repo)
content: An all-in-one managed backend for AI apps.

title: Five Areas of AI Opportunity According to Snowflake’s Ahmad Khan (3 minute read)
content: The dust is settling now that the AI hype has started to subside. Digging in, where are the real opportunities in AI?

title: Peak Data (7 minute read)
content: Peak Data explores how an internet increasingly filled with internet data might lead to model collapse, its effect on apps like ChatGPT, and possible solutions that foundation model vendors might adopt to overcome model collapse.

title: 60% faster and 50% smaller SDXL model (3 minute read)
content: A distillation of the current leading open source text to image model. The researchers claim a minimal reduction in image quality with a dramatic speed-up at inference time.

title: OpenAI creates Preparedness team (5 minute read)
content: OpenAI has created a new team to deal with frontier risks of AGI such as cyber security and nuclear disasters.

title: AI Executive Order Expected Monday (2 minute read)
content: The Biden Administration is preparing to announce a comprehensive executive order on artificial intelligence, aiming to set standards for AI adoption in federal agencies and address concerns related to AI advancements.

title: Lenovo and NVIDIA Expand Partnership for Hybrid AI Solutions (3 minute read)
content: Lenovo and NVIDIA are expanding their partnership to deliver integrated systems that utilize generative AI from edge to cloud. They aim to help enterprises swiftly deploy tailored AI applications for business innovation. Their solutions, supported by Lenovo AI Professional Services Practice, will use a hybrid cloud approach and NVIDIA's latest hardware for generative AI.

title: Evaluating GPT-4V's Optical Character Recognition Abilities (18 minute read)
content: The paper examines how well GPT-4V, a Large Multimodal Model, performs in various Optical Character Recognition (OCR) tasks, from reading scenes and handwritten texts to understanding complex document structures.

title: Image diffusion model trained on open data (24 minute read)
content: Most popular diffusion models like Stable Diffusion have been trained on a wide variety of data, but much of that data is subject to different copyright restrictions. This new model from MosaicML is trained purely on Creative Commons data and achieves similar performance to SD 2 while requiring only a fraction of the training data.

title: 4-bit Quantization in LLMs (17 minute read)
content: This research introduces LLM-FP4, a novel method to compress large language models by converting their weights and actions to 4-bit floating-point values after training.

title: ToRA (GitHub Repo)
content: ToRA is a series of Tool-integrated Reasoning Agents designed to solve challenging mathematical reasoning problems by interacting with tools.

title: Real-Time Depth Estimation for Underwater Vehicles (GitHub Repo)
content: This study presents a model tailored for underwater vehicles that can estimate real-time depth from single images by combining sparse depth details.

title: GPT Pilot (GitHub Repo)
content: GPT Pilot is an AI-powered dev tool that writes scalable apps from scratch. It enables developers to create apps using a description of the kind of app they want to build. GPT Pilot creates apps step-by-step while asking questions for clarification or help when it gets stuck. A video demo is available in the repository.

title: The convergence of data and software engineering in the age of AI (2 minute read)
content: AI needs data to work, meaning data functions are getting closer to the core of the product-building process and moving away from internal business intelligence.

title: A Versatile Approach for Pixel Matching in Images (GitHub Repo)
content: The study introduces RGM (Robust Generalist Matching), a deep learning model designed for both sparse and dense pixel matching in images. The method leverages a unique cascaded GRU module and a new large-scale dataset.

title: Reddit threatens to block Google (3 minute read)
content: Reddit may block search crawlers if it can't reach deals with generative AI companies to pay for its data. More than 535 news organizations have opted to block their content from being scraped by AI companies. X's new reading limits are due to data scraping by AI startups.

title: Amazon Ads Launches AI-Powered Imagery for Advertisers (2 minute read)
content: Amazon Ads has introduced an AI-powered image generation feature in beta that creates lifestyle and brand-themed images to improve ad performances. The tool, which requires no technical expertise, enables brands to create more engaging ads, reportedly increasing click-through rates by 40%. It will be rolled out progressively to advertisers based on customer feedback.

title: Google Invests $2B Into Anthropic (2 minute read)
content: Google has committed to a substantial investment in Anthropic, a competitor to OpenAI, earmarking up to $2 billion for the AI startup.

title: First director of the Frontier Models Forum named and big tech adds $10m to safety initiative funding (4 minute read)
content: Chris Meserole is the first director of the Frontier Models Forum. Many large tech companies have added funding to the AI safety fund.

title: Identifying Out-of-Distribution Data (14 minute read)
content: ML models can sometimes wrongly recognize unfamiliar data, thinking they've seen it before. A new method, NNGuide, helps models make better decisions, especially when identifying unknown data.

title: Towards Monosemanticity: Decomposing Language Models With Dictionary Learning (60 minute read)
content: Researchers use sparse autoencoders to tackle neural networks' polysemanticity, extracting clearer features for improved model understanding. These features influence outputs and exhibit complex interactions.

title: Emulate training a large model just by training a small one (28 minute read)
content: Emulator Fine Tuning (EFT) comes from the direct preference optimization group and explores what happens if you fine tune a small model and then project that fine tuning onto a large model. This counterintuitive strategy works shockingly well.

title: AudioFlare (GitHub Repo)
content: An all-in-one AI audio playground using Cloudflare AI Workers to transcribe, analyze, summarize, and translate any audio file.

title: Multi-Modal Prompt Injection Image Attacks Against GPT-4V (3 minute read)
content: The new GPT-4V allows for interactive conversations with image inputs but also introduces new vulnerabilities through visual prompt injection attacks, enabling exfiltration of data and execution of hidden instructions encoded in images.

title: A System for Evaluating Large Language Models (GitHub Repo)
content: This study presents "JudgeLM", a new method to efficiently evaluate Large Language Models in versatile situations. The authors developed a vast dataset and benchmarking system.

title: Is AI alignment on track? Is it progressing... too fast? (8 minute read)
content: AI alignment is a complex issue that lacks concrete benchmarks or numbers for measurement. Predictions of AI-induced doom rely on narratives rather than rigorous models. The absence of hard numbers makes it challenging to assess the state of AI alignment.

title: Deep learning in Rust (Book)
content: Rust is a popular systems programming language with strong memory safety. Burn is a framework built on these principles for efficient ML. Importantly, it offers compatibility with the Onyx runtime.

title: Thanks to AI, the future of programming may involve YELLING IN ALL CAPS (3 minute read)
content: OpenAI's prompts reveal many quirks about prompt engineering. For example, the prompts use 'please' a lot and important instructions are often all capitalized. Capitalizing instructions likely works as the models were trained on huge numbers of examples where responses clearly paid more attention to capitalized sentences. This could result in a future where people shout at their computers to get them to work better.

title: GPT-3.5-turbo is 20B parameter (2 minute read)
content: Researchers wrote that gpt-3.5-turbo (the model behind ChatGPT) is a 20B parameter model in a paper by a Microsoft research group that studies diffusion models for code. The original model was said to be 175B parameters, so there could have been retraining or distillation.

title: Announcing The Open Empathic Project (4 minute read)
content: The group behind Stable Diffusion has launched the Open Empathic project to foster emotion-detecting capabilities in open-source AI systems for more authentic AI-human interactions.

title: Biden Releases AI Executive Order (2 minute read)
content: President Joe Biden signed an executive order outlining eight goals to regulate generative AI, focusing on safety, privacy, equity, consumer protection, innovation, and responsible government use, with agencies like the NIST tasked to develop AI standards and large AI model developers required to share safety test results.

title: AMD training round 2 (17 minute read)
content: A post from MosaicML on using AMD GPUs for training large language models.

title: Reproducing OpenAI's first RLHF repository (22 minute read)
content: The HuggingFace team reproduces a 2019 repository from OpenAI that introduced some of the first RLHF ideas.

title: Using embeddings in computer vision (12 minute read)
content: Embeddings are machine-readable lists of numbers that represent some information about a piece of data. They are increasingly obtained by running the data through a neural network and looking at the activations of the model. This post pushes that idea forward with CLIP on a computer vision task and explores how to use dimensionality reduction to reason about the learned embeddings.

title: Insanely Fast Whisper (GitHub Repo)
content: Transcribe 300 minutes of audio in less than 10 minutes with OpenAI’s Whisper Large v2.

title: Personalized Image Clustering (GitHub Repo)
content: This paper introduces Image Clustering Conditioned on Text Criteria (IC⁠TC), a method that leverages vision-language models to sort images based on user-given text descriptions.

title: Azure OpenAI Logger (GitHub Repo)
content: This project aims to create a simple and easy to deploy solution to add observability to your Azure OpenAI instance. The approach adds an API Management instance as a proxy for your existing Azure OpenAI service, and funnels logs/requests/responses to an Application Insights instance. It also saves a prebuilt query to a workbook for easy access to logs.

title: Qualcomm’s Next Big Snapdragon Chip Is Full Of AI Features (2 minute read)
content: Qualcomm's upcoming Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chip, set to debut in Samsung’s Galaxy S24, emphasizes advanced AI camera tools and enhanced processing speeds.

title: Apple And AI (2 minute read)
content: Apple is lagging in AI advancements, especially when compared to competitors like Google and Microsoft, and there are doubts among Apple insiders that its AI/ML team can deliver.

title: AI Godfathers Propose Framework To Mitigate AI Risks (3 minute read)
content: AI pioneers Yoshua Bengio and Geoffrey Hinton, along with 22 other AI experts, have proposed a policy framework emphasizing AI safety and have recommended that companies and governments allocate a third of their AI R&D budget to safety efforts.

title: Isomorphic teases the next version of AlphaFold (8 minute read)
content: AlphaFold is an amazing model for science. The new work by Isomorphic Labs (a spin off from Google) extends it beyond just proteins and improves overall performance.

title: Artists Lose First Round Of Copyright Case (3 minute read)
content: A federal judge dismissed most claims in a landmark lawsuit where artists accused generative AI art generators of unauthorized image use, pinpointing deficiencies in copyright infringement accusations against Midjourney and DeviantArt.

title: OpenAI's Ilya Sutskever on Preventing Rogue Superintelligence (15 minute read)
content: OpenAI's co-founder and chief scientist Ilya Sutskever has shifted his focus from building the next model like GPT to figuring out how to avoid future artificial superintelligence from behaving undesirably. He believes the reality of AI surpassing human intelligence is imminent and anticipates technologies that will allow humans and AI to merge. Sutskever and his team at OpenAI are actively working on "superalignment", a set of procedures to control future AI technology.

title: A Mask Propagation Technique for Video Semantic Segmentation (19 minute read)
content: The study introduces MPVSS, a method for segmenting video content that reduces computational load by focusing on key frames and then predicting masks for other frames based on these key ones.

title: A Deep Dive into Medical Visual Question Answering (22 minute read)
content: The study assesses how well GPT-4 with Vision (GPT-4V) answers questions related to medical images from various sources, such as X-rays and CT scans.

title: Improving the Reliability of Diffusion Models (18 minute read)
content: Researchers have found ways to use diffusion models to make long-term plans, but these plans aren't always realistic or safe. This study introduces a method to fix those unreliable plans, using a tool called the "restoration gap".

title: Improving Multi-modal LLMs (GitHub Repo)
content: Researchers dived deep into the visual encoders used in Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and discovered that certain features from CLIP and DINO models are especially effective for detailed visual tasks. They then introduced COMM, a strategy that combines the strengths of both models.

title: A New Image Denoising Approach (GitHub Repo)
content: The study introduces PUCA, a new self-supervised denoising approach that maintains J-invariance, a critical aspect for effective denoising.

title: Efficient Video Understanding (GitHub Repo)
content: This project introduces TESTA, a method designed to speed up the process of understanding long videos by combining similar frames and patches. Using TESTA, researchers managed to greatly reduce the computational load and improve performance in matching paragraphs to videos and answering questions about long videos.

title: Hackers Are Weaponizing AI To Improve Phishing (8 minute read)
content: AI is poised to dramatically improve the success of phishing attacks, which is already used in 90% of cyberattacks.

title: Seismic Waves Of Gen Z Behavior (12 minute read)
content: This article discusses the influence of Gen Z on various industries and how their behavior is causing seismic waves in the market. The author emphasizes the importance of understanding Gen Z's habits, preferences, and values, as this generation drives significant changes in consumer behavior. By examining the social, technological, and economic aspects of Gen Z's lives, businesses can better anticipate their needs and adapt their offerings to cater to this influential demographic.

title: Death Of A Flywheel (8 minute read)
content: Death of a Flywheel discusses the decline of business flywheels, which represent self-sustaining momentum that drives company growth, due to factors including market saturation, evolving customer preferences, competitive threats, regulatory changes, and misaligned incentives. The article emphasizes the importance of recognizing and addressing these threats to ensure the continued health of a company's flywheel.

title: Stability AI teases release of 3D generation, sky replacement, and more (3 minute read)
content: 3D asset generation in the .obj format is the next big innovation for creatives working with AI. Stability AI is working to make that a possibility. This article is light on details, but it is exciting to see what is around the corner.

title: Microsoft Pushes The Boundaries Of Small AI Models With Big Breakthrough (4 minute read)
content: Microsoft Research has enhanced its smaller language model, Phi 1.5, with multimodal capabilities, enabling it to interpret images similarly to OpenAI's larger GPT-4 model but at a lower computational cost.

title: Biden’s AI Order May Have Wide Impact For Startups (3 minute read)
content: Biden has gone all in on an executive order that, while lacking teeth, gives a good sense of where the administration is coming from when it comes to AI, and from that, we can glean potential impacts on the startup ecosystem.

title: New Techniques Efficiently Accelerate Sparse Tensors For AI Models (3 minute read)
content: MIT and NVIDIA researchers developed techniques to accelerate sparse tensor processing, enhancing performance and energy efficiency in generative AI tasks.

title: LLMs Learning From Their Mistakes (16 minute read)
content: The study introduces 'Learning from Mistakes' (LeMa), a method that teaches large language models to solve math problems by learning from errors, similar to a human student improving through correcting their mistakes.

title: Neural Net Has Human-Like Ability To Generalize Language (3 minute read)
content: Researchers have developed a neural network that can generalize language similarly to humans, outperforming models like ChatGPT.

title: LangChain Templates (GitHub Repo)
content: The easiest and fastest way to build a production-ready LLM application. These templates serve as a set of reference architectures for a wide variety of popular LLM use cases.

title: How-to guide to Get Started with Llama (9 minute read)
content: This guide provides information and resources to help you set up Llama including how to access the model, hosting, and how-to and integration guides

title: Fine tune your own Mistral for $1 of compute (6 minute read)
content: Jupyter notebook example of how to fine-tune Mistral's 7B model on your own dataset.

title: Segment Anything and MetaCLIP (Hugging Face Space)
content: Open vocabulary segmentation is a somewhat new and exciting topic in computer vision. This work combines powerful base models with strong language capabilities together to segment based on text input.

title: What AI means for your product strategy (1 hour podcast)
content: Paul Adam, a long-term CP at Intercom, discusses the ways AI is going to impact the world (and your tech stack). There’s quite a bit of fear-setting in this conversation, so if this doesn’t inspire you to look into how you should be using AI, I don’t know what will.

title: Politicians Commit To Collaborate On AI Safety (3 minute read)
content: Global stakeholders discussed collaborative efforts to address AI risks through the Bletchley Declaration at the AI Safety Summit in Bletchley Park, England, aiming for a human-centric, trustworthy AI deployment. U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo announced a new AI safety institute within the Department of Commerce, emphasizing global policy alignment on AI safety, while political leaders from various countries stressed inclusivity and responsibility in navigating AI advancements.

title: UK Invests $273M In AI Supercomputer (1 minute read)
content: The UK government is investing $273 million in an AI supercomputer dubbed Isambard-AI, which will be constructed by the University of Bristol, showcasing its aspiration to excel in AI technology.

title: Stability’s AI Latest Tool Uses AI To Generate 3D Models (2 minute read)
content: Stability AI has unveiled Stable 3D, an AI-driven app aimed at simplifying 3D model creation for modeling and game development.

title: Meta’s AI Research Head Wants Open Source Licensing To Change (4 minute read)
content: Meta's Llama 2, touted as open-source, faces scrutiny due to its limited license not meeting all Open Source Initiative requirements. Despite this, Meta's VP for AI research, Joelle Pineau, emphasizes the balance between information-sharing and business costs, aiming for collaborative innovation akin to its previous open-source project PyTorch.

title: long(est) context Mistral model (3 minute read)
content: Nous research has used their Yarn method to fine-tune Mistral 7B to operate on contexts up to 128k. It shows minimal degradation on short sequence lengths and vastly improved performance on long documents.

title: long(er) context Mistral model (3 minute read)
content: Amazon enters the open source LLM game with a RoPE fine-tuned Mistral 7B that scales up to 32k tokens in context.

title: Tuning Language Models for Empathy (8 minute read)
content: Researchers have developed a way to improve empathy in large language models used for psychological counseling by creating a dataset for empathetic conversation training.

title: Open source toolkit for RAG, fine-tuning, and model serving (GitHub Repo)
content: A minimal and open source Python toolkit for building LLM applications.

title: Using ChatGPT for Image Classification (14 minute read)
content: This study shows that image classification can be improved by using large language models to organize classes into hierarchies, addressing biases in pretrained models like CLIP that confuse similar categories.

title: Code released for MoE PEFT (GitHub Repo)
content: Cohere’s research arm For AI developed parameter efficient fine-tuning for Mixture-of-Experts models. It recently released the code for the community to build on.

title: Sifting through the noise: How AI will impact information overload (5 minute read)
content: No doubt, you consume a lot of content on a weekly basis. Articles, blog posts, tweets, this newsletter. With AI, the rise of user-generated content is going to increase exponentially. The systems you build to defend your attention will be more important than ever.

title: Talk Llama (GitHub Repo)
content: Talk with a LLaMA AI in terminal.

title: AI’s role in running software companies (2 minute read)
content: From helping you to write code, checking the quality of that code, and adding repeatability to your content generation, AI is going to impact how we think about leverage in the daily operations of our software companies. This article explores the common areas you should be thinking about adding AI to your operations.

title: Elon Musk's xAI beats ChatGPT on LLM benchmarks (4 minute read)
content: xAI trained an autoregressive language model at 34B params. It is quite performant and will power an AI system built into the X platform.

title: What To Expect At OpenAI Dev Day (3 minute read)
content: OpenAI Dev Day is today and it is rumored that we can expect enhancements to OpenAI’s developer tools, new pricing plans for ChatGPT, and a peek at Gizmo V8, a new and improved version of the ChatGPT iOS app.

title: Expanding VRP for Enhanced Generative AI Security (3 minute read)
content: Google is extending its Vulnerability Rewards Program (VRP) to include generative AI, encouraging research into AI safety and security. Simultaneously, it's expanding its open-source work to ensure better AI supply chain safety. It is also leveraging the Secure AI Framework (SAIF) and the Google Open Source Security Team (GOSST) to protect AI supply chains from threats like model tampering and data poisoning.

title: Highlights from NeurIPS 2023 (45 minute read)
content: Paper digest generated summaries of many papers from NeurIPS 2023. Interestingly, much of this work is almost a year old at this point and has already been readily adopted by the community.

title: HelixNet is 3 models combined into one (4 minute read)
content: If you fine-tune three task-specific models from the Mistral base, one for generation, one for critique, and a final one for regeneration then the entire system shows dramatically improved generation performance. Synthetic data is used to tune these models.

title: Sketch what you want your robot to do (6 minute read)
content: Sketching a rough outline of what you want a robot to accomplish is a novel form of communication and turns out to work surprisingly well for standard pick and place tasks.

title: Video2Music Creates Tailored Music for Videos (GitHub Repo)
content: Video2Music’s AI framework generates emotionally congruent music for videos, leveraging a unique dataset and transformer model validated by user studies.

title: X "similar posts" powered by rust-based vector database (GitHub Repo)
content: Qdrant uses a lightning-fast vector database to store embeddings.

title: Deepspeed releases inference software (GitHub Repo)
content: This is Deepspeed's new software for competing with vLLM and text-generation interfaces for the fast serving of language models. It comes with many state-of-the-art acceleration features and preliminary results suggest it's up to 2.4x faster.

title: AI data pipeline attacks (6 minute read)
content: Poisoning the data well and other data pipeline attacks are a huge challenge for the cyber security community and often a blindspot for most AI organizations. This post outlines (with code) what the attacks are to help with future mitigation.

title: Could Cruise Be The Theranos Of AI? (4 minute read)
content: Cruise, GM's driverless car company, frequently relies on remote operators for its vehicles, challenging the company's claims of autonomy. The revelation raises concerns about the true capabilities of self-driving cars and prompts calls for transparency and investigation into the safety and autonomy of such vehicles.

title: Extensions prompt injection and data exfiltration (12 minute read)
content: A great deep dive into some novel vulnerabilities that come from generative AI plugins. In this case, the attack resembles SQL injection but came via an infected Google Doc. While Google has fixed the issue, the security researcher was able to exfiltrate other users’ prompts.

title: xAI Releases PromptIDE (5 minute read)
content: xAI has released PromptIDE, an integrated development environment for prompt engineering and interpretability research.

title: OpenAI Dev Day Recap (6 minute read)
content: GPT-4 Turbo at a fraction of the cost with 128k context, custom GPTs, and vision in the API.

title: 30T open dataset released (6 minute read)
content: Red Pajama v2 has been released. It is 2.5x larger than the dataset used to train GPT-4. There is no code data, but it does have multilingual data from 5 languages and covers an impressive breadth. Importantly, much of the deduplication work and some heuristic filtering has already been done.

title: Sharper Images with Gaussian Mixture Solvers for Diffusion Models (18 minute read)
content: Gaussian Mixture Solvers enhance diffusion models, resolving the speed-quality trade-off in image synthesis and setting new standards for image detail and clarity.

title: Enhancing Anomaly Detection with Depth-Aware Tech (16 minute read)
content: The DADA system integrates 3D data with RGB images for superior surface anomaly detection, outperforming traditional methods in speed and accuracy without extensive training datasets.

title: A Unified Approach for Language-Driven Recommender Systems (GitHub Repo)
content: CLLM4Rec synergizes large language models with ID-based systems, elevating recommendation precision through advanced pretraining and novel language embeddings.

title: TopicGPT: Discovering Topics in Text (GitHub Repo)
content: TopicGPT revolutionizes topic modeling with LLMs, producing more relevant, interpretable topics and allowing for user-guided topic refinement.

title: Detecting Deep Fakes Without Seeing Any (GitHub Repo)
content: FACTOR applies fact-checking techniques to digital media, offering a novel, effective tool for detecting unprecedented deepfake attacks without prior training.

title: OpenAI releases consistency decoder for stable diffusion (GitHub Repo)
content: Consistency decoder for the VAE dramatically improves performance for generated images for latent diffusion models. They released one for Stable Diffusion. Open source!

title: Pixel Perfect: How AI Unlocks Creativity (14 minute read)
content: This post breaks down how AI, creators, and scaled distribution tactics like virality and community-led growth are generating huge momentum across these vectors.

title: A Minor ChatGPT update is a warning to founders: Big Tech can blow up your startup at any time (3 minute read)
content: We’ve already seen it with investors not willing to invest in companies that are just wrapping GPT but now it is even more clear. With the ability to query uploaded PDFs, a whole swath of startups just got wiped off the map.

title: Will generative AI transform business? (12 minute read)
content: Generative AI's increased sophistication has led to a rise in business applications, with Insider Intelligence predicting that 25% of US internet users will use it monthly by 2023. The technology's capacity to communicate in natural language has increased accessibility, extending its use beyond tech-savvy individuals. Although still in the early stages, businesses like Yext and numerous startups are already leveraging generative AI for various tasks such as marketing content generation, customer service, product design, and data analysis.

title: The OpenAI Keynote (14 minute read)
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman showcased new features and improvements to the company’s AI models at its first developer conference, emphasizing a future where AI integration will play a central role in consumer technology. The event highlighted OpenAI's shift towards a product-centric approach, with new tools being made immediately available, and hinted at potential forays into hardware to reduce friction in AI accessibility.

title: Nvidia Is Piloting A Generative AI For Its Engineers (3 minute read)
content: Nvidia revealed the testing of a large language model named ChipNeMo to enhance chip designers' productivity during a keynote at the IEEE/ACM International Conference on Computer-Aided Design. Although not yet fully proven, ChipNeMo aids in scripting for design tools, summarizing bug reports, and serving as an experienced chatbot for designers.

title: YouTube To Test Generative AI Features (2 minute read)
content: YouTube is testing new generative AI features as part of its premium subscription service. These features include a conversational tool for asking questions about content and getting recommendations and another for summarizing comment topics.

title: Efficient Learning for Sentence Embedding (21 minute read)
content: Cross-View Training (SCT) elevates small language models, enabling them to produce sentence embeddings previously only achievable by larger models, optimizing both performance and computational efficiency.

title: Transformer based diffusion model is 90% cheaper to train than UNet based models (5 minute read)
content: PixArt is a new text to image model that uses T5 text encodings, cross attention, and a diffusion transformer to great results at a fraction of the compute cost of comparable models.

title: Enhancing Language Models Without Retraining (GitHub Repo)
content: The DARE method streamlines the enhancement of language models like BERT, allowing the integration of new functions into a unified model, increasing efficiency on various linguistic tasks.

title: Instant 3D Search (GitHub Repo)
content: OVIR-3D innovates 3D object retrieval from text prompts using 2D image fusion, bypassing the need for 3D data training and facilitating instant, real-time search capabilities ideal for robotics.

title: CogVLM-17B open vision language model (3 minute read)
content: With 10B vision parameters and 7B language parameters, this multimodal model excels at many standard benchmarks and performs well on human evaluation.

title: Langroid multi-agent programming framework (GitHub Repo)
content: Inspired by the Actor framework, this lightweight Python library makes it easy to create LLM-powered agents.

title: Are Language Models Good At Making Predictions? (5 minute read)
content: In a study using 5000 questions from Manifold Markets, GPT-4 was found to be consistently overconfident in its predictions.

title: OpenAI Is A Lot More Vulnerable Than You Think (4 minute read)
content: On the heels of OpenAI releasing functionality that decimated half GPT-wrapper companies, here is a contrarian view of the blind spots and weaknesses of OpenAI as this market continues to evolve.

title: Almost An Agent: What GPTs Can Do (8 minute read)
content: OpenAI's latest GPTs edge closer to the vision of autonomous AI agents. They are capable of executing tasks like crafting academic papers with minimal human input, despite current constraints like occasional inaccuracies. This leap forward in AI autonomy promises significant advancements but also underscores the urgency for vigilant development to mitigate potential vulnerabilities as AI begins to navigate more complex and independent roles.

title: Google Announces Expansion Of AI Partnership With Anthropic (4 minute read)
